bibl.title: Letter from L. O. Howard to Walter Reed, August 27, 1900

div1.p: Howard informs Reed that Dr. Coquillett identified the species of the mosquitoes that Lazear collected. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from L. O. Howard to Walter Reed, August 27, 1900
div1.p:
I have yours of the 24th, and the additional
material from Dr. Lazier. I have asked Dr. Coquillett to deter-
mine the species and the following is the list:

“Dr. Finlay's, Culex fasciatus Fabr.
Marianao, " " "
Quemados, " " "
Pinar del Rio, 1, Culex perturbans Walk., and C.
pungens Wied.
" " " 2, Limnobia Sp.
" " " 3, 4 and 5, Culex perturbans Walk.
" " " 6, Culex fasciatus Fabr.
Havana, 1, Geranomyia rufescens Loen.
" 2, Culex pungens Wied.
Port Hospital, Geranomyia rostrata Say.”
Of course, Limnobia and Geranomyia are not mosquito genera.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, L.O. Howard Entomologist.
Dr. Walter Reed,
War Department,
Surgeon General's Office,
Washington, D. C.
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES
LITTERA
SCRIPTA
MANET
* 1934 *
THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.
RECORDS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, Bureau of
Entomology and Plant Quarantine.
Three Centimeters
